titleStmt.title: A shield against the Parthian dart, or, A word to the purpose, shot into Wallingford-House. Answered in defence of the present actions of state here in England, that produced the late change of government. By J.S.
titleStmt.author: Streater, John, fl. 1650-1670.
Spittlehouse, John, attributed name.

notesStmt.note: A reply to: A word to purpose.
The appendix is a reply to: Anglesey, Arthur Annesley, Earl of. England's confusion.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
